data.text:
Our Advisors worked with the client team to develop and finalise a procurement strategy, which was ultimately presented to the NSW Premier and Roads Minister.

Each of the recommended procurement strategies were additionally supported by the necessary commentary and risk analysis.

Our Advisors supported our client in the development of the procurement strategy of both the Western Harbour Tunnel and the Beaches Link Tunnel. The purpose of this procurement strategy was to inform our client, and the NSW Government, of potential delivery strategies and associated timeframes to deliver both projects.

Elements of the procurement strategy produced by our Advisors included:

setting project objectives

reviewing contract packaging

reviewing potential contracting model options

delivering detailed analysis and assessment of the contracting models

describing the proposed procurement process

proposing the project program

reviewing market capacity for the project, including potential contracting participants and competing projects for resources, and

providing conclusions and recommendations.

The scope of these services included:

closely liaising with our client’s project team and senior management to discuss risks, issues and constraints

working with our client and other advisors (technical, legal and environmental)

designing the development, procurement and delivery programs based on key objectives and keeping in mind milestone targets, and

providing procurement strategy options that took into account the client’s risk transfer appetite.
